references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: What are the rules under Part 125/135 for the number of radios required to be carried for Air Operations (ATOs and CTOs)?
questions.answer: The aircraft must be fitted with a sufficient number of radios such that the failure of one radio does not prevent continued communication for the route being flown.

questions.question: What is the requirement for operable equipment if flying an aircraft under Part 135 that has no Minimum Equipment List (MEL)?
questions.answer: All instruments and equipment installed in the aircraft are required to be in operable condition.

questions.question: Under Part 125 and 135 what emergency equipment is required to be carried and clearly identified in the aircraft, regardless of the number of seats?
questions.answer: An axe. A first aid kit. A fire extinguisher.

questions.question: Under Part 135, can refuelling be carried out while passengers are embarking, on board, or disembarking the aircraft? If so, what rules apply?
questions.answer: Yes. Only for Class 3.1C (Jet A1) and Class 3.1D (Diesel). The person operating the aircraft must ensure the safety and aircraft evacuation precautions are taken in accordance with procedures specified in the Operator's Procedures ('Operations') Manual.

references.text: CAR Part 135.73 - Refuelling and defuelling operations.
